demos.prompt:
[{'content': "You are a helpful assistant that answers in JSON. Here's the json schema you must adhere to:
<schema>
{'title': 'InventoryManagement', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {'inventoryID': {'title': 'Inventory ID', 'type': 'string'}, 'products': {'title': 'Products', 'type': 'array', 'items': {'type': 'object', 'properties': {'productID': {'title': 'Product ID', 'type': 'string'}, 'quantity': {'title': 'Quantity', 'type': 'integer'}}, 'required': ['productID', 'quantity']}}, 'totalValue': {'title': 'Total Value', 'type': 'number', 'format': 'float'}, 'lastUpdated': {'title': 'Last Updated', 'type': 'string', 'format': 'date-time'}}, 'required': ['inventoryID', 'products', 'totalValue', 'lastUpdated']}
</schema>
", 'role': 'system'}, {'content': "I am managing the inventory for a health care provider and need to create a structured JSON object to keep track of our inventory. The inventory includes various medical products, each with a unique product ID and quantity in stock. I need the JSON to include our inventory ID, a list of products with their IDs and quantities, the total value of the inventory, and the date and time when the inventory was last updated. Here's the data for our current inventory: Inventory ID: HC123456, Total Value: $250000.00, Last Updated: 2023-04-05T10:00:00Z. The products are as follows: Product ID: MED12345, Quantity: 100 units; Product ID: MED12346, Quantity: 200 units; Product ID: MED12347, Quantity: 150 units. Please respond with a valid JSON object.", 'role': 'user'}]

[{'content': "You are a helpful assistant that answers in JSON. Here's the json schema you must adhere to:
<schema>
{'title': 'LoanApplication', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {'applicationID': {'title': 'Application ID', 'type': 'string'}, 'applicantDetails': {'type': 'object', 'properties': {'name': {'title': 'Name', 'type': 'string'}, 'income': {'title': 'Income', 'type': 'number'}, 'creditScore': {'title': 'Credit Score', 'type': 'integer'}}, 'required': ['name', 'income', 'creditScore']}, 'loanType': {'title': 'Loan Type', 'type': 'string'}, 'amountRequested': {'title': 'Amount Requested', 'type': 'number'}, 'repaymentSchedule': {'title': 'Repayment Schedule', 'type': 'string'}}, 'required': ['applicationID', 'applicantDetails', 'loanType', 'amountRequested', 'repaymentSchedule']}
</schema>
", 'role': 'system'}, {'content': "I am submitting a loan application to Central City Bank and need to create a structured JSON object with my application details. My application ID is 'CCB-981276', my name is 'Barry Allen', my annual income is $85,000, and my credit score is 750. I am applying for a 'Home Improvement Loan' for the amount of $20,000. The repayment schedule agreed upon is 'Monthly payments for 5 years'. Please respond with a valid JSON object that includes these details.", 'role': 'user'}]

[{'content': "You are a helpful assistant that answers in JSON. Here's the json schema you must adhere to:
<schema>
{'title': 'BugReport', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {'reportID': {'title': 'ReportID', 'type': 'string'}, 'description': {'title': 'Description', 'type': 'string'}, 'severity': {'title': 'Severity', 'type': 'string', 'enum': ['low', 'medium', 'high', 'critical']}, 'status': {'title': 'Status', 'type': 'string', 'enum': ['open', 'in progress', 'resolved', 'closed']}}, 'required': ['reportID', 'description', 'severity', 'status']}
</schema>
", 'role': 'system'}, {'content': "As a software developer at InnoTech Solutions, I'm tasked with creating a system to log and track bug reports for our new project management software. I need to generate a JSON object for each bug report that comes in. The JSON object should include the following details: a unique identifier for the report under 'reportID', a 'description' of the bug, the 'severity' of the bug which can be categorized as 'low', 'medium', 'high', or 'critical', and the current 'status' of the bug which can be 'open', 'in progress', 'resolved', or 'closed'. For instance, we've just received a bug report with the following details: reportID: 'BUG-001122', description: 'The calendar view crashes when switching from week to month view.', severity: 'high', and status: 'open'. Please provide me with a valid JSON object that corresponds to this bug report.", 'role': 'user'}]
demos.step_by_step_instructions:
```json
{
  "reportID": "BUG-001122",
  "description": "The calendar view crashes when switching from week to month view.",
  "severity": "high",
  "status": "open"
}
```
demos.constructed_json_object:
{
  "reportID": "BUG-001122",
  "description": "The calendar view crashes when switching from week to month view.",
  "severity": "high",
  "status": "open"
}
```

demos.prompt:
[{'content': "You are a helpful assistant that answers in JSON. Here's the json schema you must adhere to:
<schema>
{'title': 'HardwareInventoryItem', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {'itemID': {'title': 'Item ID', 'type': 'string'}, 'itemName': {'title': 'Item Name', 'type': 'string'}, 'itemCategory': {'title': 'Item Category', 'type': 'string'}, 'quantity': {'title': 'Quantity', 'type': 'integer'}, 'supplier': {'title': 'Supplier', 'type': 'string'}}, 'required': ['itemID', 'itemName', 'itemCategory', 'quantity', 'supplier']}
</schema>
", 'role': 'system'}, {'content': "I am in charge of managing the inventory for our company's IT department, and I need to update our records with the latest hardware acquisitions. We recently purchased several high-capacity SSDs for our data center. Specifically, we acquired 20 units of the Samsung 860 EVO 2TB SATA III SSDs, with the itemID SSD860EVO-2TB. These are intended for use in our server farm to enhance data retrieval speeds and overall storage capacity. The supplier for these SSDs is TechSource Distributors. I require a JSON object that encapsulates these details for our inventory management system. The item category for these SSDs is 'Storage Devices'. Please respond with a valid JSON object that includes the itemID, itemName, itemCategory, quantity, and supplier.", 'role': 'user'}]
demos.completion: {"itemID": "SSD860EVO-2TB", "itemName": "Samsung 860 EVO 2TB SATA III SSD", "itemCategory": "Storage Devices", "quantity": 20, "supplier": "TechSource Distributors"}

predictor.signature_instructions: Proposed Instruction: Transform the provided text with key-value pairs into a valid JSON object that conforms to the specified JSON schema. Ensure all required fields are included and that data types match the expected format in the schema. Use curly braces to encapsulate your resulting JSON structure, commas to separate items within an array, colons to separate keys from values, and quotation marks for string literals.

[{'content': "You are a helpful assistant that answers in JSON. Here's the json schema you must adhere to:
<schema>
{'title': 'HardwareInventoryItem', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {'itemID': {'title': 'Item ID', 'type': 'string'}, 'itemName': {'title': 'Item Name', 'type': 'string'}, 'itemCategory': {'title': 'Item Category', 'type': 'string'}, 'quantity': {'title': 'Quantity', 'type': 'integer'}, 'supplier': {'title': 'Supplier', 'type': 'string'}}, 'required': ['itemID', 'itemName', 'itemCategory', 'quantity', 'supplier']}
</schema>

We recently purchased several high-capacity SSDs for our data center. Specifically, we acquired 20 units of the Samsung 860 EVO 2TB SATA III SSDs, with the itemID SSD860EVO-2TB. These are intended for use in our server farm to enhance data retrieval speeds and overall storage capacity. The supplier for these SSDs is TechSource Distributors. retry_predictor.signature_instructions:
This signature is designed to handle errors in JSON object construction by focusing on identifying and rectifying the errors in the JSON output. The model uses this signature to understand the nature of the error and to guide the correction process in a retry mechanism. This is crucial for tasks requiring high accuracy in data format and structure adherence to a JSON schema.

    Instructions: Review the incorrect JSON object, identify the mismatches against the specified JSON schema, and modify the text or processing logic to correct these errors. The goal is to refine the JSON output in subsequent iterations until it fully complies with the JSON schema.
